    "Imagine an e-commerce platform specializing in handmade crafts. The interface needs to highlight the uniqueness and the craft quality of the items. It should make browsing through categories easy and provide detailed views of the products. User reviews and a seamless checkout process are also important features.",
    
    "We're creating a mobile game with a focus on puzzle-solving elements. The interface should be colorful and engaging, inviting the user into a world of challenge and mystery. Buttons need to be large enough to be clickable, and the game's progress should be easily accessible.",
    
    "The software is a digital art application aimed at professional artists. The interface must provide quick access to a wide range of tools, layers, and color palettes without overwhelming the user. A customizable workspace and the ability to import and export various file formats are key.",
    
    "Develop an interface for an educational app that teaches children aged 6-8 basic math skills. The interface should be very visual, with interactive elements and rewards for completing exercises. It should allow for different levels of difficulty and include motivational feedback.",
    
    "The software is a music production tool that allows artists to create, mix, and master their tracks. The interface should be structured in a way that makes it easy to access the mixer, the library of sounds, and the various effects. It should also support drag-and-drop functionality for arranging parts of a track.",
    
    "Create the interface for a personal finance application that helps users budget and track their spending. It should provide visual representations of their financial data, like charts and graphs. Users should be able to categorize transactions and set spending alerts.",
    
    "Consider designing an interface for a language learning app that connects native speakers with learners for practice. It should include a text and video chat feature, a searchable list of available language partners, and a way to schedule sessions. The interface must also be culturally sensitive and inclusive.",
    
    "The software is an advanced weather forecasting tool intended for researchers and meteorologists. The interface should display complex data in a comprehensible manner, with abilities to customize views, compare historical weather patterns, and receive alerts on severe weather changes."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "User Interface Development",
  "description": "This subtask involves creating and implementing the graphical elements that users interact with in software. It requires designing the layout, defining user interactions, and ensuring the interface is intuitive and accessible. The outcome should be a user-friendly and aesthetically pleasing interface that complements the underlying code.",
  "system_prompt": "Develop a user-friendly and accessible interface for the software described in the text that follows.",
  "data": [
    "Imagine a task management app that enables users to create, assign, and track tasks within a team. The app should offer different views such as a Kanban board, a calendar view, and a simple to-do list. Users must be able to set deadlines, priorities, and add attachments.",

    "Envision an online bookstore where users can browse through categories, view book details, and read reviews. The interface should include a powerful search function, recommendations based on past purchases, and a secure and simple checkout process.",

    "Consider a fitness tracker application that records workout details, tracks progress over time, and provides health insights. The interface needs to display data effectively, provide motivational prompts, and integrate with other health apps seamlessly.",

    "Design the user interface for an email client that prioritizes ease of use, with features including a robust spam filter, smart categorization of emails, and customizable folders. The layout should be clean and should support various email protocols.",

    "Construct an interface for a music streaming service that includes playlist creation, radio stations, and social sharing. The design should be audio-centric with minimalistic aesthetic that allows for easy navigation between songs, albums, and artists.",

    "Develop an educational platform that services both students and teachers. Features should include course creation, a grading system, and collaborative tools. The interface must be straightforward enough for users of all ages to navigate with ease.",

    "Create a UI for a photo editing software with advanced features like layer management, filters, and color correction. The layout must be intuitive and should enable users to easily switch between basic and advanced modes depending on their skill level.",

    "Imagine a mobile banking app with robust security features that allows users to check balances, transfer funds, and deposit checks using their smartphone camera. The design should enhance readability and navigation, with a focus on clear transaction history and account management.",

    "Design a travel booking website that offers flight, hotel, and car rental reservations. The interface should streamline the booking process, provide clear options for filtering and comparing prices, and give tips based on the user's travel history.",

    "Develop an interface for a smart home app that controls lighting, temperature, and security systems. The app should allow for easy switching between manual and automated controls, with a dashboard providing a quick overview of the current status of all connected devices."
  ]
}

Creative Writing and Composition.descr: This category is for tasks that require the generation of new content or ideas. It emphasizes creativity, originality, and the ability to construct meaningful or aesthetically pleasing outputs.
subtasks:
{
  "name": "Character Development",
  "description": "This subtask aims to elaborate and enhance individual character profiles within a text. It involves crafting detailed backstories, personalities, and motivations to create more nuanced and compelling characters. The objective is to deepen readers' understanding and connection to the characters in the creative work.",
  "system_prompt": "Generate detailed character profiles for the following text, focusing on creating nuanced backstories and motivations.",
  "data": [
    "Margaret, a seasoned detective, finds herself at a crossroads when the cold case that haunted her career for decades finally reveals a new clue. Known for her sharp intellect and relentless pursuit of justice, she must confront the personal demons that the case has embedded in her psyche.",
    "Jasper, the timid bookstore owner, harbors a secret passion for adventure novels, indicative of his desire for a life beyond the confines of his small town. Despite his quiet demeanor, there's a well of untapped courage waiting to be discovered when his world is turned upside down by an unexpected visitor.",
    "Elena, a gifted ballet dancer, grapples with the pressure of living up to her family's legacy in the arts. Her fear of disappointing those she loves is matched only by her drive to forge her own path, a struggle that takes center stage as she prepares for the most important audition of her career.",
    "Liam, a retired army general, has found solace in the serene life of gardening after a tumultuous career. His stoic exterior masks the complexity of emotions brought on by a life of service and sacrifice, as he cultivates his garden, which serves as a metaphor for his journey toward peace.",
    "Sophia, a high-flying corporate lawyer, is known for her icy demeanor and fierce negotiation skills. However, her ambition is driven by a deep-seated need to prove her worth beyond the shadows of her family's tarnished reputation, a quest that may lead her to redefine her ideas of success and family loyalty.",
    "Oliver, a charming con artist, thrives on the adrenaline of each successful scam. But as he plans his most significant heist yet, a sense of emptiness creeps in, making him question the solitary life he's constructed and whether redemption is still within reach.",
    "Aurora, an enigmatic graffiti artist, uses the city walls as her canvas to broadcast her political defiance. Behind her vibrant murals lies a history of struggle against an oppressive regime that silenced her family, her art becoming the loudspeaker for her resistance and hope for change.",
    "Nathan, a child prodigy in quantum physics, is on the verge of a breakthrough that could revolutionize the world. Yet, with his youth and inexperience come a vulnerability to the darker forces in academia, and a naivety about the practical implications and ethical dilemmas of his work.",
    "Grace, a renowned chef, has built an empire on her ability to combine flavors in unexpected ways. Her innovation in the kitchen is a tribute to her adventurous spirit, but it's also a cover for her fear of stagnation, both in her career and in the stagnant relationship with her business partner.",
    "Charles, an old lighthouse keeper, has withstood the test of time, much like the lighthouse itself. His resilience in facing the relentless sea sprouts from a long history of navigating personal tragedies, and the lighthouse has become his steadfast companion through the years, guiding him just as it does for the ships at sea."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Character Development",
  "description": "This subtask aims to elaborate and enhance individual character profiles within a text. It involves crafting detailed backstories, personalities, and motivations to create more nuanced and compelling characters. The objective is to deepen readers' understanding and connection to the characters in the creative work.",
  "system_prompt": "Generate detailed character profiles for the following text, focusing on creating nuanced backstories and motivations.",
  "data": [
    "Claire, a middle-aged professor of marine biology, has always had an insatiable curiosity about the ocean depths. Despite her achievements, she's haunted by the one mystery she's never been able to solve – the disappearance of her younger sister at sea. Constantly torn between her academic pursuits and a deep-seated need for closure, her work is both her escape and her penance.",
    
    "Eliot, the enigmatic new transfer student with striking green eyes, keeps to himself and never talks about his life before moving to town. Unknown to his peers, he harbors a secret artistic talent and a history of parental neglect, which fuels his ambition to create and be recognized for something entirely his own.",
    
    "Maggie, known in her small town as 'Hurricane Maggie' for her whirlwind presence and fierce independence, hides the vulnerability that comes from growing up in a series of foster homes. Her bravado masks a deep desire to belong and to build a stable life that she's never known.",
    
    "Leonard, a retired army general, spends his days meticulously tending to his garden, a stark contrast to his rigid military past. His love for gardening is both a therapy for PTSD and a tribute to his late wife, who found peace among the flowers.",
    
    "Sasha, a tech-savvy teenager with aspirations of becoming a cybersecurity expert, is driven by the challenge of outsmarting digital systems. However, her motivations are complicated by her aim to dismantle the online network that ensnared her brother in illegal activities.",
    
    "Dr. Grant, the stoic and seemingly cold-hearted surgeon, is revered for his precision and feared for his lack of bedside manner. Beneath his austere exterior lies the burden of a decision that cost a patient their life early in his career, a mistake he's pledged to never make again.",
    
    "Fiona, a vivacious and renowned travel blogger, lives a life many dream of, but each new destination fills the void left by a lost love. Her escapades are not just a search for content, but a quest to find someone who made travel – and life – seem like an everlasting adventure.",
    
    "Lyle, an old-time jazz musician who's played side gigs all his life, carries the spirit of the Roaring Twenties in a modern world that's left him behind. He's witnessed the rise and fall of many a talent, including his own fleeting brush with fame, and he plays every note in homage to the music that once defined him.",
    
    "Pamela, a high-powered attorney with a sharp wit and sharper wardrobe, fights ruthlessly for her clients. She was inspired by her mother's legal battles to keep their family home, and now uses her own success to help those who struggle against the weight of the system.",
    
    "Arthur, a gentle and aging bookstore owner, delights in recommending the perfect book for each customer. Having never traveled beyond his city, he's lived a thousand lives through the pages of novels and seeks to afford others the same escape that he's cherished throughout the years."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Setting Expansion",
  "description": "The focus here is to enrich the setting where the narrative unfolds. It requires detailing the environment, historical period, or cultural context to better immerse the reader. The goal is to provide a vivid and well-established backdrop for the story.",
  "system_prompt": "Expand on the setting described in the input text, giving elaborate environmental and historical context.",
  "data": [
    "The town of Crestwood was nestled in a valley surrounded by the towering Greymont Range. Its quaint streets lined with family-owned shops had a storybook charm that belied its founding during the harsh winter of 1847, when pioneers sought a new life in the untamed West.",
    "On the shores of Lake Serenity, a small community of wooden huts and docks made up the village of Fisher's Cove. This isolated settlement relied heavily on the bountiful waters for survival and had developed a rich tradition of songs and tales about the lake's mysterious depths and the creatures that were said to dwell within.",
    "Amid the sprawling savanna, the ancient city of Keshar stood as a testament to the grandeur of a forgotten empire. Its massive stone walls and intricate carvings spoke of a culture that once thrived on commerce and innovation, connecting distant lands through a network of trade routes that crisscrossed the desert.",
    "In the shadow of an old mill, the district of Lowtown huddled against the soot-covered factories that had grown around it. The cobblestone streets were a labyrinth of squalor and destitution, a stark contrast to the smoggy skies and the towering industrial marvels that were the pride of Victorian innovation and progress.",
    "The colony of New Haven was perched on the rocky cliffs of the New World, braving the Atlantic winds. Its timber-framed houses and cobbled streets were a patchwork of architectural styles, reflecting the mix of cultures and hopes of the immigrants who had braved the ocean in search of freedom and a new start in the early 17th century.",
    "High above the dense canopy of the Rainwalker Forest, ancient trees reached for the sky, their trunks as wide as houses. These woods were rumored to be untouched since the time of legends, home to spirits and creatures spoken of in hushed tones by the indigenous people who lived at its fringes and respected its mysteries.",
    "Beneath the neon glow of towering holographic billboards, the city of Neo-Tokyo sprawled into the night, a testament to post-modern design and cybernetic advancements. At street level, the melding of traditional heritage with ultra-modern technology created a pulsating culture of innovation, rooted in a society that had risen from the ashes of the 21st-century calamities.",
    "Set against the backdrop of the early Renaissance, the bustling streets of Florence were alive with the fervor of new ideas. Artists and philosophers mingled with merchants and nobles, creating a tapestry of human potential that was reflected in the stunning architecture and the vibrant art that adorned the city walls and courtyards.",
    "The space station Alpha Centauri Orbital was a hub of interstellar activity, floating in the void between star systems. Its design was a blend of technologies contributed by various alien civilizations, creating a microcosm of galactic society that was as diverse in its inhabitants as it was in its architectural marvels.",
    "Deep within the Appalachian Mountains, the mining town of Coal Hollow clung to the rugged hillsides. The scars of extraction were deeply etched into the landscape, telling the story of generations of workers who had delved into the earth for the coal that fueled the nation's industrial heartbeat through the early 20th century."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Plot Structuring",
  "description": "This subtask deals with organizing the series of events that make up the narrative. It involves outlining a clear beginning, development, climax, and resolution to ensure a coherent and engaging storyline. The purpose is to create a satisfying narrative arc that captivates the audience.",
  "system_prompt": "Outline a narrative arc for the input text, including a beginning, climax, and resolution.",
  "data": [
    "When an unassuming librarian, Sarah, discovers a mysterious book that is not listed in any catalogues or records, her curiosity gets the better of her, leading her down a rabbit hole of secrets. As she decodes the unknown language in the book, she realizes it contains the wisdom of an ancient civilization and their powerful secrets. The climax of the story occurs when a shadowy organization seeks to claim the book for their malicious purposes, chasing Sarah across the city. With her quick wits and courage, she outsmarts them and ensures the book's safety, preserving the ancient knowledge and finding her true calling as a guardian of hidden truths.",
    
    "In the sleepy town of Millfield, the arrival of a charismatic stranger stirs excitement and suspicion in equal measure. Young Tom, enthralled by the stranger's tales of adventure, runs away with him, only to learn that his new mentor is a notorious con artist. The story reaches its climax when Tom is faced with a moral dilemma during a high-stakes scam. Ultimately, Tom foils the con and returns home, wiser and more appreciative of the simple life he once scorned.",
    
    "A gifted young painter, Elizabeth, loses inspiration after the passing of her mentor and struggles to complete her masterpiece. In her search for a muse, she embarks on a journey through the vibrant and eclectic art districts of Paris. The story's climax is reached when her most significant work is almost destroyed by a rival, sparking a new creative fire within her. Elizabeth triumphantly unveils her work, redefining her voice and revolutionizing the art world.",
    
    "During a brutal winter, a brash mountaineer named Jack challenges the elements to reach the peak of the untamed Everest II. Along the way, he forms an unlikely alliance with a team of researchers stranded in a storm. The narrative peaks when Jack saves the team from a catastrophic avalanche but suffers injuries. In the resolution, Jack's experience teaches him humility and the value of teamwork, and he is hailed as a hero as he recovers with a newfound respect for the mountain.",
    
    "The quiet village of Greenlake is rocked when its beloved statue goes missing, and amateur detective Lily decides to take the case. She stumbles upon a series of clues that reveal the deep-seated rivalries among some of the village's most influential figures. The climax occurs during the annual festival, where Lily exposes the thief and the motives in a dramatic confrontation. The statue's recovery leads to the village healing old wounds and Lily earning respect as a true detective.",
    
    "In a future where dreams are taxed by a tyrannical government, Mia, a dream artist, creates experiences that allow people to escape reality. Her talents bring hope to a downtrodden society, but also attract the attention of the authorities. The story's climax sees Mia captured and her dreams weaponized. However, she engineers a dream so powerful that it inspires a revolution. Mia's bravery eventually sees the overthrow of the regime, and she is remembered as the architect of a new dream of freedom.",
    
    "On the day of his retirement, seasoned detective James finds an old, unsolved case file on his desk, stirring up a long-forgotten sense of justice. He decides to use his remaining time to solve the mysterious disappearance of a local girl. The climax reveals the girl had staged her disappearance to escape a dangerous cult. In the resolution, James saves her from a grim fate, and in doing so, finds peace in a career well-served and a life-saving closure.",
    
    "At a prestigious boarding school, shy student Emma discovers her talent for magic in a world where it's forbidden to commoners. She practices in secret, perfecting her skills, until she’s caught in the act. The story's climax unfolds as Emma must use her abilities to save the school from an ancient curse, revealing her powers to all. Emma's actions tear down the barriers between commoners and magicians, ushering in a new era of unity and equality in the school.",
    
    "When planet Earth starts losing gravity in certain areas, causing chaos and destruction, young scientist Theo dedicates himself to uncovering the cause. His investigation leads him to a forgotten satellite experiment that's disrupting the planet's gravitational field. The climax of the narrative occurs when Theo must spacewalk to repair the satellite under perilous conditions. In the resolution, Theo not only restores gravity but also gains recognition as a pioneer in space technology, securing the safety of humankind.",
    
    "Ella, a talented but overlooked musician, writes a song that accidentally becomes a viral hit overnight, credited to a famous pop star. The escalation of the story peaks as Ella fights to prove her authorship, facing the dark side of the music industry. The resolution sees Ella perform a breathtaking live rendition, winning the crowd and earning her place in the spotlight while sparking a movement for artist rights."
  ]
}

    "Despair hung in the air like thick fog, suffocating the room with an invisible weight that pressed on our shoulders, making each step feel like wading through a swamp of molasses."
  ]
}

Textual Adaptation and Transformation.descr: This category is for tasks that require the generation of new content or ideas. It emphasizes creativity, originality, and the ability to construct meaningful or aesthetically pleasing outputs.
subtasks:
{
  "name": "Alternative Endings Creation",
  "description": "This subtask requires the writer to reimagine the conclusion of a story, creating one or more alternative endings. It involves a creative understanding of the narrative's tone, characters, and plot to ensure coherence with the original storyline. The aim is to provide readers with different possible outcomes that are engaging and thought-provoking.",
  "system_prompt": "Devise an alternative ending for the following story, ensuring it aligns with the narrative's established elements.",
  "data": [
    "As the sun dipped below the horizon, Emily stood at the edge of the cliff, watching the waves crash against the rocks. She had finally found the treasure her grandfather had told stories about, but now she faced a grave decision: to take the treasure for herself, as her grandfather had intended, or to donate it to the struggling town that her family had been part of for generations. The original ending had her walking away, leaving the treasure behind, but now you must create a new conclusion.",
    "In the original ending, Max defeated the dragon terrorizing the village and was honored as a hero. He was given a place of honor at the king's court, but he found no satisfaction in the luxurious life at the castle. Longing for adventure, Max left the kingdom in search of a new quest. Write an alternative ending where Max makes a different choice after slaying the dragon.",
    "The ancient prophecy had foretold that the chosen one would bring balance to the warring kingdoms, but as Lila stood on the battlefield, she realized there was an alternative path. The original story ends with Lila uniting the kingdoms through her marriage to Prince Aric. However, consider an ending where Lila forges a different kind of unity.",
    "In an unexpected twist of fate, the villain, Lord Vrax, attained the Orb of Power, granting him dominion over time itself. The original story saw the hero, Cassia, snatching the orb in the last moment, saving the world from destruction. Provide an alternative ending where Cassia confronts Lord Vrax, but the outcome is different.",
    "With the mystery of the Whispering Woods finally solved, the group of friends planned to return to their normal lives, their bonds stronger than ever after facing shared perils. The original ending of the story had the friends parting ways, enriched by their experiences. Think of an alternative conclusion where the revelation in the woods has a lasting impact, changing their lives dramatically.",
    "After journeying across treacherous lands, Sir Alden reached the enchanted spring, the source of the kingdom's prosperity. He had the choice to either drink from the spring to gain immortality, as in the original ending, or use its waters to heal his ailing father, the king. Imagine an end where Sir Alden's decision leads to an outcome that affects the entire kingdom.",
    "The machine had been stopped, and the world was safe once more. In the story's climax, the scientist, Dr. Elara, sacrificed herself to destroy her creation that threatened to envelope the world in eternal darkness. Explore an alternative scenario where Dr. Elara survives the ordeal, but there are unforeseen consequences to her actions.",
    "Upon finding the lost city of gold, Elena faced a moral dilemma when confronted by the descendants of the city's ancient protectors. In the story's original finale, she respected their wishes, leaving the city untouched and keeping its secret. Now, devise a different ending where Elena's decision leads to a different interaction with the city's guardians.",
    "The conflict between the magical realms had reached its peak when the oracle, Sibylla, stepped forth with a vision that could end the war. Originally, her vision led to a truce, but it was a fragile peace that wouldn't last. Propose an alternative ending where Sibylla's vision leads to a more permanent, albeit unexpected, resolution.",
    "In the narrative's conclusion, young inventor Tobias succeeded in launching his airship, achieving his dream of flying higher than anyone before. However, at the story's end, he vanished into the clouds, leaving his fate ambiguous. Imagine a different ending where Tobias's journey in the airship leads to an astonishing discovery that changes everything for him and his world."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Educational Adaption",
  "description": "This subtask targets the transformation of the text to serve educational purposes, such as creating study guides, lesson plans, or adaptations for young readers. It involves tailoring the content to fit pedagogical objectives, ensuring that the adaptation is both informative and age-appropriate. The end product should facilitate learning while keeping the text engaging.",
  "system_prompt": "Adapt the following text for educational purposes, making it informative and age-appropriate.",
  "data": [
    "The water cycle is the journey water takes as it circulates from the land to the sky and back again. The sun's heat provides energy to evaporate water from the Earth's surface. Plants also lose water to the air (this is called transpiration).",
    "Photosynthesis is a process used by plants and other organisms to convert light energy into chemical energy that can later be released to fuel the organism's activities. This chemical energy is stored in carbohydrate molecules, such as sugars, which are synthesized from carbon dioxide and water.",
    "In mathematics, the Fibonacci sequence is a series of numbers where each number is the sum of the two preceding ones, usually starting with 0 and 1. This sequence is a common pattern in nature, found in the arrangement of leaves on a stem and the branching of trees.",
    "In history, the Industrial Revolution was a period between the 18th and 19th centuries when major changes in agriculture, manufacturing, mining, transportation, and technology had a profound effect on the socioeconomic and cultural conditions of the times.",
    "Gravity is the force by which a planet or other body draws objects toward its center. The force of gravity keeps all of the planets in orbit around the sun. It also holds us on the ground and makes objects fall.",
    "A healthy diet includes eating a variety of foods from the five major food groups: fruits, vegetables, grains, protein foods, and dairy. The body needs these nutrients to work properly, grow, and develop. We get energy from the food we eat.",
    "Volcanoes are formed by the movement of tectonic plates. The Earth's crust has seventeen major pieces that float on a hot, softer layer in the Earth's mantle. When these plates move, they can create mountains, earthquakes, or volcanoes.",
    "The judicial branch of government is designed to interpret the laws of a country, ensuring they are applied fairly and in accordance with the constitution. The court system, which includes the Supreme Court and other lower courts, handles this responsibility.",
    "Ecosystems are communities of living organisms and nonliving components that interact as a system. These biotic and abiotic components are linked together through nutrient cycles and energy flows. An ecosystem can be as small as a pond or as large as a rainforest.",
    "Shakespeare's 'Romeo and Juliet' is a play that tells the story of two young lovers whose deaths ultimately reconcile their feuding families. It was written by William Shakespeare early in his career and is one of his most popular plays."
  ]
}

Assisting with Emails.descr: This category is for tasks that require the generation of new content or ideas. It emphasizes creativity, originality, and the ability to construct meaningful or aesthetically pleasing outputs.
subtasks:
{
  "name": "Email Reply Generation",
  "description": "This subtask involves generating a relevant and coherent response to an incoming email.",
  "system_prompt": "Generate a coherent email reply based on the following message, maintaining context and appropriate tone.",
  "data": [
    "Dear Jamie, I just wanted to check in and see how the new software implementation is going. Have you encountered any issues or roadblocks that I should be aware of? Your feedback is invaluable to us as we try to improve the rollout process for future clients. Warm regards, Alex",
    "Dear Taylor, I've reviewed your most recent manuscript submission and I'm impressed with the narrative and character development. Before we proceed to the publishing phase, could you please confirm whether you've acquired the necessary permissions for the quoted materials? Looking forward to your response. Cheers, Morgan",
    "Hi Sam, I noticed that the monthly report on departmental expenses is overdue. The executive team is requesting this document by end of day today for their review. Could you please provide an update on its status? Thank you, Robin",

    "Hello Alex,

Could you provide an estimation and let me know your availability over the next month?

Sincerely,
Jordan Patterson",
    "Hi there,

I am currently planning my wedding and came across your photography portfolio. Your work is stunning, and we would love to have you capture our special day. The wedding is scheduled for June 15th. Looking forward to your response,
Emily",
    "Hello Team,

As the deadline for the Harrison project is approaching, I wanted to remind everyone that we need to submit all our documents and final designs by next Friday. Best,
Liam, Project Manager",
    "Good afternoon Dr. Smith,

I have been experiencing persistent headaches for the last two weeks, and they seem to be getting worse. Over-the-counter medication doesn't provide much relief. Thank you,
Avery Johnson",
    "Dear Tech Support,

Regards,

    "Hello Ms. Adams,

I received the contract for the upcoming freelance project. Before I sign, I have a couple of questions. First, the payment terms mentioned are net-60, but I usually work with a net-30 structure. Best,

    "Hi Customer Service,

I recently made a purchase on your website, order number #12345, but received the wrong item. I ordered the Ocean Blue Duvet Cover, but I received the Arctic White one instead.     "Greetings,

Thanks,

Warm regards,
Sophia"

}

Culinary Assistance and Guidance.descr: This category is for tasks that require the generation of new content or ideas. It emphasizes creativity, originality, and the ability to construct meaningful or aesthetically pleasing outputs.
subtasks:
{
  "name": "Recipe Recommendation",
  "description": "This subtask involves suggesting recipes based on specific criteria such as available ingredients, dietary restrictions, or desired cuisine.",
  "system_prompt": "Suggest recipes tailored to the following criteria: ingredients, dietary restrictions, and cuisine preferences.",
  "data": [
    "I have chicken breast, carrots, and celery in my fridge. I'm looking for a paleo-friendly dish that doesn't include dairy, and I'd like to try something with Asian flavors.",
    "My pantry is full of lentils, tomatoes, and onions. I need a vegetarian recipe, and I'm interested in Middle Eastern cuisine, but I am allergic to nuts so please exclude any recipes containing them.",
    "I'm searching for a gluten-free dessert recipe using apples, cinnamon, and oats. I prefer sweet over savory, and I'm open to any type of cuisine as long as it's gluten-free.",
    "I want to make a vegan pasta dish using zucchini, spinach, and mushrooms. I'd like an Italian meal that is low in calories and doesn't involve any fake cheeses or processed ingredients.",
    "I love seafood and have shrimp, garlic, and lemons. I'm on a ketogenic diet, so I need a keto-friendly recipe that brings out the Mediterranean flavors but without any starchy sides like rice or bread.",
    "I have beef, potatoes, and green beans. I'm looking for a hearty meal that's also suitable for a diabetic diet. Preferably, I would like a traditional American dish.",
    "We have tofu, bell peppers, and snap peas on hand. We're looking for a high-protein vegan meal, ideally with some Thai influences, but we need to avoid anything with soy sauce or gluten.",
    "I have a sweet tooth and want to use my ripe bananas, cocoa powder, and almond flour. I'm following a paleo diet, so I need a grain-free and refined sugar-free dessert recipe, possibly a baked treat.",
    "I just bought some fresh salmon, asparagus, and dill. I'm looking for a low-calorie, pescatarian recipe that has Scandinavian roots, and it should be simple enough for a weeknight dinner.",
    "I have quinoa, black beans, and corn. I would like a high-fiber, plant-based meal that does not contain any dairy or meat, with a preference for Mexican flavors."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Cooking Technique Explanation",
  "description": "This subtask is focused on clarifying cooking techniques in simple steps.",
  "system_prompt": "Explain the cooking technique presented next, breaking it down into clear, manageable steps.",
  "data": [
    "Sautéing involves cooking food quickly in a small amount of oil or butter in a frying pan over medium-high heat. It often requires tossing the food occasionally to ensure even cooking and prevent burning, making it ideal for tender vegetables or thin slices of meat.",
    "Braising is a cooking method that requires searing the food at a high temperature and then cooking it slowly in liquid inside a covered pot. This technique is excellent for tougher cuts of meat, as the slow cooking at low temperatures makes the meat more tender.",
    "Sous-vide is a method of cooking in which food is placed in a vacuum-sealed bag and then cooked in a water bath at a precisely controlled temperature, often lower than normally used for cooking. This method ensures even cooking and retains moisture, making it perfect for meats and vegetables.",
    "Folding is a gentle mixing technique used when combining ingredients like whipped cream or meringue with a heavier mixture. It involves using a spatula to cut through the mixture, then gently turning it over and over, being careful not to deflate the airy ingredients.",
    "Blanching is a technique that involves boiling food briefly, then plunging it into ice water to halt the cooking process immediately. This method is great for vegetables, as it helps retain their color, flavor, and nutrients, and also eases the removal of skins from nuts and fruits.",
    "Poaching is a method of cooking delicate foods such as eggs or fish by submerging them in a liquid at a low simmer. The liquid should never come to a full boil, and this technique results in tender and moist cooked food.",
    "Steaming is a method of cooking using steam heat by placing food in a basket or rack above boiling water. The food cooks due to the steam's heat, making it a healthy way to cook since it requires no additional fat and preserves nutrients.",
    "Caramelizing is the process of cooking sugar until it becomes a dark amber liquid used to flavor and garnish desserts. This technique requires careful heat control to avoid burning the sugar.",
    "Grilling is a method of cooking that involves direct heat from below. It is great for cooking meats and vegetables, giving them a distinct charred flavor. It is important to preheat the grill and clean the cooking grate before using.",
    "Roasting is a cooking method that uses dry heat, either in an oven or over an open flame. The food is cooked evenly on all sides, often leading to a flavorful crust. It is ideal for large, tender cuts of meat and for vegetables."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Cooking Technique Explanation",
  "description": "This subtask is focused on clarifying cooking techniques in simple steps.",
  "system_prompt": "Explain the cooking technique presented next, breaking it down into clear, manageable steps.",
  "data": [
    "Sautéing is a method where food is cooked quickly in a minimal amount of fat or oil on a hot pan. Ingredients are usually cut into small pieces to ensure even cooking.",
    "Braising involves cooking food slowly in a small amount of liquid, typically after searing it at a high temperature. This method is excellent for adding flavor and tenderness to tougher cuts of meat.",
    "Poaching is a gentle cooking process where food is submerged in a liquid at a low temperature, ensuring the food cooks evenly and retains moisture. This technique is often used for delicate items like eggs or fish.",
    "Blanching requires immersing ingredients into boiling water for a short period, then rapidly cooling them in ice water. This process helps to preserve color, texture, and nutritional value in vegetables.",
    "Steaming involves cooking food with steam by placing it above boiling water in a closed pot or steamer. It's a healthy way to cook because it doesn't involve added fats, and it preserves nutrients.",
    "Broiling is a high-heat cooking method done in an oven. Food is placed on a broiler pan and exposed to direct heat from above, which results in a caramelized, crispy surface.",
    "Folding is a technique used to combine a light, airy ingredient with a heavier mixture. It's done by gently turning one part over another with a spatula, cutting through the center, and turning the bowl slightly with each fold.",
    "Searing involves quickly cooking the outer surface of food at high temperature to form a flavorful brown crust. This is often done before the food is finished cooking by another method like roasting or braising.",
    "Caramelizing is the process of cooking sugar until it becomes a brown liquid with a rich, sweet, nutty flavor. This can be done with granulated sugar or naturally occurring sugars in foods like onions.",
    "Deglazing is the technique of adding liquid, like stock or wine, to a pan to dissolve the browned bits of food left after sautéing or searing. This creates a flavorful base for sauces and gravies."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Cooking Technique Explanation",
  "description": "This subtask is focused on clarifying cooking techniques in simple steps.",
  "system_prompt": "Explain the cooking technique presented next, breaking it down into clear, manageable steps.",
  "data": [
    "Sautéing involves cooking food quickly in a small amount of oil or butter over relatively high heat. The key is to cut the food into uniform pieces for even cooking and to keep it moving in the pan, often by tossing or flipping, to prevent burning and ensure thorough cooking.",
    "To blanch vegetables, start by boiling a large pot of water and prepare a bowl of ice water on the side. Add the vegetables to the boiling water and cook for a short period, typically a few minutes. Afterward, quickly remove them and plunge them into the ice water to halt the cooking process, preserving their color and texture.",
    "Braising is a two-step cooking process. First, sear the meat at a high temperature until it is browned. Then, cook it slowly in a closed pot at a lower temperature with a little amount of liquid, resulting in tender, flavor-infused meat.",
    "Caramelizing onions requires patience. Begin by thinly slicing the onions and cooking them slowly in fat, like oil or butter, over medium heat. Stir the onions frequently until they are a deep golden brown color. The natural sugars in the onions will gradually caramelize, creating a sweet, rich flavor.",
    "To poach an egg, first bring a pot of water to a slight simmer, then add a splash of vinegar. Crack an egg into a small bowl and gently slide it into the water. Cook until the egg whites are set but the yolk remains runny, about 3 to 4 minutes. Finally, remove the egg with a slotted spoon and drain it on a paper towel.",
    "To properly sear a steak, allow the steak to come to room temperature. Heat a skillet over high heat and add oil with a high smoke point. Once the oil is shimmering, place the steak in the skillet. Cook without moving it until a brown crust forms on the bottom. Then, flip it over to sear the other side.",
    "Julienning is a technique used to cut vegetables into thin, uniform matchsticks. Start by washing and peeling the vegetable. Cut it into 2-3 inch sections before slicing it into thin sheets. Stack the sheets and slice them again into thin matchstick-sized pieces.",
    "Steaming involves cooking food using the steam from boiling water. Fill a pot with a small amount of water, insert a steamer basket, and bring the water to a boil. Place the food in the basket, cover the pot, and reduce the heat to a simmer. The steam will cook the food gently, preserving nutrients and texture.",
    "To temper chocolate, first chop the chocolate into small, even pieces. Slowly melt two-thirds of the chocolate over a double boiler, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add the remaining one-third of chocolate, stirring until smooth. This process stabilizes the chocolate, giving it a smooth texture and shiny finish.",
    "For deep-frying, choose an oil with a high smoke point and pour it into a deep frying pot or skillet, typically 2-3 inches deep. Heat the oil to the desired temperature, often between 350°F to 375°F. Carefully add the food in small batches to avoid dropping the temperature of the oil and cook until it's golden brown and crispy. Drain on a paper towel to remove excess oil."

}

{
  "name": "Food Safety Guidelines",
  "description": "This subtask provides information on proper food handling and safety.",
  "system_prompt": "Provide food safety guidelines regarding handling, storage, and cooking temperatures for the following scenarios.",
  "data": [
    "In a professional kitchen, chefs must ensure that poultry is stored at temperatures below 40°F to prevent bacterial growth. Raw poultry should be cooked to an internal temperature of 165°F to safely kill any potential pathogens. Cross-contamination is avoided by using separate cutting boards for meats and vegetables.",
    "When organizing a community barbecue, hamburgers should be grilled until they reach an internal temperature of 160°F. It's essential to keep the raw meats separated from other food items to avoid cross-contamination. Leftovers must be promptly refrigerated within 2 hours of cooking, or 1 hour if the outdoor temperature exceeds 90°F.",
    "During a seafood restaurant shift, chefs must ensure that shellfish are received at temperatures no higher than 50°F and stored immediately in a fridge set at 40°F or below. Shellfish should be cooked to 145°F. Additionally, it's important to discard any mussels, oysters, or clams that do not open during cooking.",
    "While preparing a picnic, cold salads containing mayonnaise, such as potato or egg salad, must be kept cooled in an insulated container with ice packs to maintain a temperature below 40°F. It is critical to avoid leaving these salads out in the sun where they can reach temperatures that allow bacteria to multiply quickly.",
    "For a sushi chef, it's imperative to use fish that has been properly frozen to kill parasites prior to serving raw. The storage temperature for sushi-grade fish should be at -4°F or below. The chef should also wear gloves when handling the fish to maintain sanitary conditions.",
    "In a bakery setting, it is important to store perishable items like dairy-based frostings or cream-filled pastries in a refrigerator at 40°F or below. These items should never be left at room temperature for more than 2 hours to prevent the growth of harmful bacteria.",
    "A caterer handling a large buffet must ensure that hot foods are maintained at 140°F or warmer, using chafing dishes or heat lamps. Cold dishes should be kept on ice or in a chilled unit to remain below 40°F. Dishes should be switched out every 2 hours to maintain appropriate temperatures and freshness.",
    "When canning homemade preserves, it's crucial to use the water-bath method or pressure canning to ensure that all bacteria, yeasts, and molds are destroyed. The jars must be sealed properly and stored in a cool, dark place. Any jar that doesn't seal must either be reprocessed within 24 hours, refrigerated, or consumed immediately.",
    "For a deli that serves cold cuts and sandwiches, meats and cheeses should be sliced in small batches to minimize the time they are out of refrigeration. Deli slicers and prep areas must be sanitized every 4 hours to prevent listeria contamination. All deli meats must be stored below 40°F and should not be used past their expiration date.",
    "When operating a food truck, it's important to monitor the refrigerator and freezer with accurate appliance thermometers to ensure the food is kept at safe storage temperatures, 40°F for the refrigerator and 0°F for the freezer. Food handlers should wash their hands frequently, especially after handling money, to prevent cross-contamination."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Food Safety Guidelines",
  "description": "This subtask provides information on proper food handling and safety.",
  "system_prompt": "Provide food safety guidelines regarding handling, storage, and cooking temperatures for the following scenarios.",
  "data": [
    "Scenario: You're preparing a fresh chicken salad for a picnic. Before handling the chicken, wash your hands with soap and warm water for at least 20 seconds. Store the raw chicken at a temperature below 40°F (4°C) to prevent bacterial growth. Cook the chicken to a minimum internal temperature of 165°F (74°C) before slicing it for the salad. Keep the salad chilled below 40°F until serving.",
    "Scenario: A restaurant receives a large delivery of beef and fish that will be stored before cooking. Upon arrival, check that the beef and fish were transported at 40°F (4°C) or below. Store beef at a temperature between 32°F (0°C) and 36°F (2°C), and store fish between 30°F (-1°C) and 34°F (1°C). Ensure raw meats are stored below ready-to-eat foods to avoid cross-contamination.",
    "Scenario: At a food stall, you are slated to serve pork sausages to customers. Prior to cooking, keep the sausages refrigerated at or below 40°F (4°C). Use separate utensils and surfaces for raw and cooked sausages to prevent cross-contamination. Cook the sausages to an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C). Serve hot and avoid letting cooked sausages sit out at room temperature for more than two hours.",
    "Scenario: A family is hosting a barbecue event and plans to serve homemade beef burgers. When forming patties, handle the meat as little as possible to prevent bacteria from hands contaminating the meat. Keep the raw patties chilled and cook them to an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C). Once cooked, keep the burgers at 140°F (60°C) or warmer until served.",
    "Scenario: A caterer is preparing sushi for a wedding reception. Use sushi-grade fish that has been properly frozen to kill parasites. Store the fish at a temperature of 30°F (-1°C) until ready to prepare. Handle rice and other ingredients with gloves, and keep prepared sushi at a temperature below 40°F (4°C) until served.",
    "Scenario: You’re baking and decorating a batch of cupcakes for a school fundraiser. Ensure all ingredients, especially dairy and eggs, are fresh and have been stored properly. Bake the cupcakes until they pass the toothpick test to ensure they are fully cooked. If using cream-based frosting, keep the cupcakes refrigerated until they are ready to be displayed and sold.",
    "Scenario: Cooking a turkey for a holiday dinner. Thaw the turkey in the refrigerator and not at room temperature, allowing 24 hours for every 4 to 5 pounds. Cook the turkey to a minimum internal temperature of 165°F (74°C), checking the temperature at the thickest part of the breast and thigh. Let the turkey rest for at least 20 minutes before carving.",
    "Scenario: Operating a mobile food truck serving hot dogs and soft pretzels. Keep the hot dogs refrigerated at 40°F (4°C) or lower before grilling or steaming them to at least 140°F (60°C). Warm the soft pretzels in a heated display case that maintains a temperature of at least 140°F (60°C) to prevent bacterial growth.",
    "Scenario: Storing leftovers after a family dinner. Divide large amounts of leftovers into shallow containers to cool quickly to a safe temperature. Refrigerate leftovers within two hours of cooking, ensuring the refrigerator is set below 40°F (4°C). Consume or freeze leftovers within 3 to 4 days.",
    "Scenario: Packing lunches for a school field trip. Use insulated lunch boxes with ice packs to keep perishable items like sandwiches with deli meats, yogurt, and cheese at a safe temperature. Include non-perishable items like nuts, fruits, and vegetables that are less sensitive to temperature variations. Advise children to discard any perishable food items not eaten during the trip instead of bringing them home."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Food Safety Guidelines",
  "description": "This subtask provides information on proper food handling and safety.",
  "system_prompt": "Provide food safety guidelines regarding handling, storage, and cooking temperatures for the following scenarios.",
  "data": [
    "Scenario: A restaurant prepares chicken dishes and needs to ensure the meat is stored and cooked safely. Guidelines: Raw chicken should be stored at or below 40°F (4°C) and never left out at room temperature for more than two hours. Poultry should be cooked to an internal temperature of at least 165°F (74°C) to eliminate harmful bacteria.",
    
    "Scenario: A seafood vendor transports fresh fish to local markets. Guidelines: Fresh seafood should be kept on ice and maintained at or near 32°F (0°C) during transport. Gloves should be worn when handling the fish to prevent cross-contamination. Seafood should be cooked to 145°F (63°C) or until opaque and separates easily with a fork.",
    
    "Scenario: A family picnic with a variety of dishes including potato salad. Guidelines: Potato salad containing mayonnaise should be kept in coolers with ice or freezer packs, maintaining a temperature below 40°F (4°C) to prevent the growth of harmful bacteria. It should not be left out in the sun or warm temperatures for more than an hour.",
    
    "Scenario: A deli setting up a buffet-style service. Guidelines: Ready-to-eat foods should be kept separate from raw foods to avoid cross-contamination. Cold dishes should be kept on ice or refrigerated units, and hot dishes should be maintained at 140°F (60°C) or above. Buffet items should be replaced every two hours to ensure freshness and safety.",
    
    "Scenario: Cooking beef hamburgers at a barbecue event. Guidelines: Ground beef should be cooked to an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C) to ensure all bacteria are killed. Use a meat thermometer to check for doneness, and avoid using the same utensils for raw and cooked meat without proper cleaning to prevent cross-contamination.",
    
    "Scenario: Storing leftovers from a large family dinner. Guidelines: Leftovers should be refrigerated within two hours of cooking. They should be divided into smaller portions and placed in shallow containers to cool quickly. Reheat leftovers to at least 165°F (74°C) before serving.",
    
    "Scenario: A bakery managing cream-filled pastries. Guidelines: Pastries should be stored in a display case at or below 41°F (5°C). Cream-filled items are potentially hazardous and should be kept out of the temperature danger zone (40°F - 140°F or 4°C - 60°C) to minimize bacterial growth. Any unsold pastries should be discarded after 24 hours.",
    
    "Scenario: Handling raw eggs in a restaurant kitchen. Guidelines: Store eggs in their original carton at an internal temperature of 45°F (7°C) or lower. Avoid pooling eggs to prevent the spread of bacteria. Cook eggs until yolks and whites are firm, or for dishes containing eggs, to an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C).",
    
    "Scenario: A grocery store's produce section. Guidelines: Fresh produce should be displayed away from non-food items and raw animal products. Fruits and vegetables should be washed thoroughly under running water before being sliced or prepped for sampling. Any cut produce should be refrigerated at 40°F (4°C) or below.",
    
    "Scenario: Preparing sushi with raw fish at a Japanese restaurant. Guidelines: Raw fish must be frozen at -4°F (-20°C) or below for at least seven days or frozen at -31°F (-35°C) or below until solid and stored at -31°F (-35°C) or below for 15 hours to kill parasites. Sushi chefs should practice hand hygiene and use clean equipment to avoid cross-contamination."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Culinary Terminology Clarification",
  "description": "This subtask involves explaining culinary terms and jargon.",
  "system_prompt": "Clarify the culinary terms listed next to assist in understanding cooking instructions and terminology.",
  "data": [
    "To achieve a perfect béchamel, ensure that you cook the roux until it's golden before slowly whisking in the milk to prevent lumps.",

    "To chiffonade the basil, stack the leaves, roll them tightly, and then slice across the roll to produce fine ribbons.",
    "While making the custard, temper the eggs by slowly adding some hot milk to them before combining everything back into the pot to avoid curdling.",
    "For aeration of the flour when baking, it is often advised to sift it before adding to the mix to incorporate air and remove clumps.",
    "Brining the chicken will ensure it retains moisture during cooking; submerge it in a solution of salt and water, and sometimes sugar and spices for added flavor.",
    "When the recipe mentions to fold in the egg whites, gently combine them with the batter using a spatula in a sweeping motion to prevent deflating the mixture.",
    "To caramelize the onions, cook them slowly over low heat in some butter or oil until they are a rich golden brown, which will bring out their natural sweetness."
  ]

{
  "name": "Culinary Terminology Clarification",
  "description": "This subtask involves explaining culinary terms and jargon.",
  "system_prompt": "Clarify the culinary terms listed next to assist in understanding cooking instructions and terminology.",
  "data": [
    "Al dente: A term used to describe the texture of pasta that is cooked to be firm to the bite. The pasta should have a slight resistance when bitten into, but should not be hard or uncooked in the center.",
    "Braise: A cooking method that involves searing food at a high temperature and then finishing it in a covered pot at a lower temperature while sitting in some amount of liquid which often adds flavor and keeps the food moist.",
    "Chiffonade: A technique in which leafy green vegetables or fresh herbs are stacked, rolled, and sliced into thin ribbons. This method is often used to prepare greens for garnishing or to include in soups and salads.",
    "Deglaze: The process of adding liquid, such as stock or wine, to a pan to loosen and dissolve the food particles that are stuck to the bottom after cooking, which is often used to make a sauce or gravy.",
    "En papillote: A method of cooking in which food is put into a folded pouch or parcel and then baked. The parcel is typically made from parchment paper or foil, and this technique allows food to steam in their own moisture and retain flavor.",
    "Fond: The browned bits and caramelized drippings of meat and vegetables that are left in a pan after sautéing or roasting. Fond is often deglazed to form the base of a sauce or gravy.",
    "Julienne: A culinary knife cut in which food items are cut into long thin strips, similar in size to matchsticks. Commonly used for vegetables in stir fries or as a garnish.",
    "Macerate: To soften or break down food, especially fruit, by soaking it in a liquid so that it absorbs the flavor of the liquid. Often used to enhance the flavor of fruit with sugar or alcohol.",
    "Quenelle: A presentation technique in which a smooth substance, such as a mousse, ice cream, or pâté, is shaped into an elegant, three-sided oval using two spoons. It's also the name for a type of light dumpling made from fish, meat, or vegetables.",
    "Roux: A mixture of fat (especially butter) and flour used in making sauces. It is cooked over low heat and used as a thickening agent for many sauces and gravies. The color of the roux determines the color and flavor of the final sauce; it may be white, blond, or brown."
  ]
}

Humor and Joke Crafting.descr: This category is for tasks that require the generation of new content or ideas. It emphasizes creativity, originality, and the ability to construct meaningful or aesthetically pleasing outputs.

  "name": "Pun Creation",
  "description": "This subtask involves creating puns based on the content provided, using wordplay to elicit humor.",
  "system_prompt": "Craft a pun from the following input, utilizing wordplay to generate humor based on content context.",
  "data": [
    "I'm reading a book on anti-gravity. It's impossible to put down!",
    "Did you hear about the mathematician who's afraid of negative numbers? He'll stop at nothing to avoid them!",
    "Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything!",
    "I told my wife she was drawing her eyebrows too high. She looked surprised.",
    "I have a few jokes about unemployed people, but none of them work.",

    "Why couldn't the bicycle stand up by itself? It was two-tired!"

}

{
  "name": "Irony Crafting",
  "description": "This subtask focuses on creating expressions of irony, where the intended meaning is the opposite of the literal meaning.",
  "system_prompt": "Craft an ironic statement from the following text, where the literal meaning opposes the intended humor.",
  "data": [
    "After spending hours trying to fix his computer without success, Jeff concluded the day by stating, 'Well, I guess that was incredibly productive.'",
    "During a heatwave, with the temperatures soaring above 100 degrees, Emma stepped outside and exclaimed, 'Ah, what a perfect day for a marathon, don't you think?'",
    "In the midst of a terrible downpour that flooded the streets, Dylan remarked to his friend, 'You know, I just love how my shoes double as swimming pools; it's quite refreshing.'",
    "As the soccer team lost 10-0, the coach said, 'I'm delighted to see our defense tactics were executed flawlessly today.'",
    "While watching a clearly overcooked steak on his plate at a fancy restaurant, Tom told the waiter, 'My compliments to the chef, it's just how I like it: nice and charcoal.'",
    "After accidentally breaking her favorite vase, Lisa looked at the shards scattered across the floor and mused, 'Well, that's one way to redecorate the living room.'",
    "The office printer jammed again for the fifth time that day, and Sarah cheerfully noted, 'This printer is just so reliable, it never misses an opportunity to take a break.'",
    "Following a disastrous haircut, Mark looked in the mirror, grinned, and said, 'Perfect, just in time for my fashion model debut.'",
    "When his flight was delayed for the third time that day, Chris chuckled and remarked, 'I always appreciate how this airline is so committed to giving me extra time to enjoy the airport ambiance.'",
    "Seeing her tent collapse for the fourth time under the weight of heavy rain, Jenny quipped, 'Well, at least we're getting that indoor-outdoor living experience we always wanted.'"
  ]
}

{

subtasks:

Hobby Development Assistance.descr: This category is for tasks that require the generation of new content or ideas. It emphasizes creativity, originality, and the ability to construct meaningful or aesthetically pleasing outputs.
subtasks:
{
  "name": "Hobby Selection Guidance",
  "description": "This subtask involves assisting users in identifying hobbies that align with their interests and lifestyles.",
  "system_prompt": "Analyze the text that follows to suggest hobbies tailored to the user's interests and lifestyle.",
  "data": [
    "Since childhood, I have always been fascinated by the stars and the vastness of the universe. I'm an introverted person and enjoy contemplative activities that I can do alone at home or in peaceful outdoor settings. I work as a software developer, so I spend a lot of time in front of a computer screen.",
    "I am a retired school teacher who loves to stay active. I have participated in community gardening in the past and enjoyed it immensely. My knees aren't as good as they used to be, so I'm looking for a hobby that is gentle on the joints but still allows me to spend time outdoors.",
    "I'm a single parent with two young kids, and we're always looking for new activities to do together on the weekends. We have a small backyard, and we all love to play in it. I'm also interested in finding hobbies that can help educate my children while being fun.",
    "I spend my weekdays working in a high-stress corporate job. To de-stress, I like to engage in activities that are entirely different from my work life. I'm looking for a hobby that helps me to relax and is also sociable since I enjoy meeting new people.",
    "I've recently moved to a coastal city and am intrigued by the ocean. I have always been an athletic person, and I'm interested in taking up a new hobby that involves physical activity and allows me to explore the seaside environment.",
    "As a music lover and an avid concert-goer, I've been wanting to go beyond just listening to music and start creating my own. I don't have any experience with musical instruments, but I'm willing to learn and dedicate evenings and weekends to this new hobby.",
    "I'm a full-time blogger who works from home. I love writing and reading, but I'm looking for a hobby that can take me away from the laptop screen and allow me to do something with my hands. I am particularly interested in activities that can also be done indoors during the colder months.",
    "I am an adventurous soul with a love for adrenaline-pumping activities. I have tried extreme sports in the past, like bungee jumping and skydiving, and I look forward to engaging in a hobby that gives me a similar thrill but can be done more regularly and with a group.",
    "I've always been interested in history and enjoy watching documentaries and visiting museums. I'm looking for a hobby that allows me to immerse myself in historical study and perhaps even participate in community events or societies.",
    "I'm a professional chef looking for a hobby that does not involve cooking. I have a keen eye for detail and enjoy creating beautiful things. I'm looking for a hobby that can be both a creative outlet and a way to unwind after busy days in the kitchen."
  ]
}

{
  "name": "Skill Assessment Tools",
  "description": "This subtask revolves around identifying or creating tools for the user to assess their current skill level.",
  "system_prompt": "Propose skill assessment tools for the hobby mentioned next, to track the user's progression.",
  "data": [
    "For guitar playing, a skill assessment tool could be a mobile app that listens to the user's performance and provides feedback on accuracy, timing, and chord progression. The app could track improvements over time and offer new pieces that match the user's skill level.",
    "For painting, an assessment tool could be a virtual gallery where the user uploads their artwork. The tool analyzes the use of color, composition, and technique to offer constructive feedback. It also compares the user's work with various skill levels to show where they stand.",
    "For cooking, a tool could be an interactive cookbook app that quizzes the user after they attempt each recipe, rating them on taste, presentation, and technique. The app would record these ratings to show the user's progress and suggest recipes to improve weak areas.",
    "For learning a new language, a tool could be a software program that analyzes the user's speaking, reading, writing, and comprehension skills through a series of tests and games, providing a comprehensive skill profile.",
    "For chess, an online platform with puzzles and endgame scenarios where the user is scored on accuracy and time taken to solve them could serve as a skill assessment tool. The platform could track user statistics and rank them by skill level.",
    "For digital photography, a peer-reviewed platform where users submit their photos for critique could be used. The feedback on composition, lighting, and technique, along with a scoring system, would help photographers gauge their skill level.",
    "For programming, a coding challenge website that provides exercises and projects of increasing complexity could serve as a skill assessment tool. The system could give feedback on code efficiency and problem-solving skills and track progress.",
    "For gardening, a journal app where users log their plant growth, pest problems, and harvest yields could be utilized. The app could provide insights into the user's gardening skills and offer tips based on the data collected.",
    "For running, a GPS watch or app that tracks the user's speed, distance, and heart rate could provide detailed reports on their performance. As users meet certain benchmarks, the tool can assess their skill and endurance level.",
    "For yoga, a tool could be an AI-powered video analysis program in which users submit their practice videos. The tool evaluates form, balance, and breath control, providing a score and personalized feedback for improvement."
  ]
}

  "name": "Safety Guidelines",
  "description": "The subtask is to inform the user about safety precautions related to their hobby.",
  "system_prompt": "Outline safety precautions and best practices for the hobby detailed in the next passage.",
  "data": [
    "When practicing archery, it's essential to use the proper gear, including arm guards and gloves, to protect yourself from bowstring injuries. Always inspect your equipment before use for any signs of damage. A dedicated shooting area should be established that is clear of people and potential hazards, with a secure and appropriate backstop for missed shots.",
    
    "In woodworking, always wear safety glasses or face shields to protect your eyes from flying particles and harmful dust. Never remove guards from power tools and make sure all tools are properly maintained and sharpened. Always work in a well-ventilated space and use a dust mask or respirator to protect your lungs.",
    
    "For mountain biking enthusiasts, wearing a helmet is non-negotiable to prevent head injuries. Gloves and padded shorts can provide additional protection and comfort. It's also important to check your bike before each ride, focusing on the brakes and tire pressure, and to carry a repair kit with you for emergencies.",
    
    "Scuba diving requires adherence to training protocols and pre-dive checks. Always dive within your certification limits and never alone. Monitoring your air supply is critical, as is maintaining a slow ascent rate to avoid decompression sickness. Wearing appropriate thermal protection and using a dive computer to track your depth and time underwater are also key safety practices.",
    
    "When engaging in rock climbing, a helmet should be worn at all times to protect against falling debris and head injuries in the event of a fall. Harnesses, ropes, and other climbing gear should be checked for wear and damage before each climb. Climbers should be knowledgeable about proper belaying techniques and always climb with a partner.",
    
    "For electrical work as a hobby, one should always turn off the power at the source before beginning any repairs or modifications. Using tools with insulated handles and wearing rubber-soled shoes can prevent electrical shocks. It's also crucial to double-check wiring against electrical diagrams and to avoid working in damp or wet conditions unless properly protected.",
    
    "Candle making involves handling hot wax, which can cause burns. Use a thermometer to monitor the temperature of the wax, never leaving it unattended on the stove. Work in a well-ventilated area and on a surface covered with newspaper or a silicone mat to catch spills. Keep a fire extinguisher nearby as a precautionary measure.",
    
    "When flying drones, it's important to always maintain a line of sight with the unmanned aircraft and to avoid flying near airports or in restricted airspace. Be aware of local regulations regarding drone heights and proximity to buildings. Ensure your drone’s battery is fully charged before each flight and that its firmware is up to date to avoid technical issues mid-air.",
    
    "In home-brewing beer, sanitization is paramount to prevent contamination and spoilage. All equipment that comes into contact with the beer must be cleaned and then sanitized. Additionally, careful monitoring of the fermentation temperature is essential to producing a good quality brew. Wear gloves and eye protection when handling chemicals for cleaning and sanitizing equipment.",
    
    "During horseback riding, wearing a properly fitted helmet can drastically reduce the likelihood of head injuries. Riders should also wear boots with heels to prevent their feet from slipping through the stirrups. It's essential to approach and handle horses with calm and deliberate movements and to always ride at a level appropriate to your skill."

Prompt Development and Customization.descr: This category is for tasks that require the generation of new content or ideas. It emphasizes creativity, originality, and the ability to construct meaningful or aesthetically pleasing outputs.
subtasks:
{
  "name": "Targeted Prompt Refinement",
  "description": "This subtask involves modifying existing prompts to target specific user groups or individuals.",
  "system_prompt": "Refine the following prompt to appeal specifically to the designated user group, considering their unique characteristics.",
  "data": [
    "Original Prompt: 'Share your best tips for staying organized at work.' Target User Group: New Parents. Refined Prompt: 'Parents with little ones know time is precious. Share your best tips for staying organized at work while juggling family responsibilities.'",
    "Original Prompt: 'What are some strategies to save money on groceries?' Target User Group: College Students. Refined Prompt: 'College budgets can be tight! What are your top strategies for saving money on groceries while balancing studies and social life?'",
    "Original Prompt: 'Recommendations for a first-time visit to Paris.' Target User Group: Senior Travelers. Refined Prompt: 'Embarking on a new adventure can be thrilling at any age. For first-time visitors to Paris in their golden years, what are the must-see locations and senior-friendly activities?'",
    "Original Prompt: 'How to get started with meditation and mindfulness.' Target User Group: High-Stress Professionals. Refined Prompt: 'In a high-pressure work environment, finding calm can be a game-changer. What are your beginner tips for meditation and mindfulness to help busy professionals unwind and refocus?'",
    "Original Prompt: 'Fun and educational activities for children during summer.' Target User Group: Teachers. Refined Prompt: 'Teachers have a unique understanding of children's educational needs. What are your suggestions for fun and educational summer activities that can help students retain what they've learned over the school year?'",
    "Original Prompt: 'Efficient ways to prepare for a marathon.' Target User Group: Amateur Runners. Refined Prompt: 'New to the running scene and aiming for a marathon? What are some efficient training methods for amateur runners to build endurance and prepare for their first marathon race?'",
    "Original Prompt: 'Best practices for creating a successful blog.' Target User Group: Aspiring Women Entrepreneurs. Refined Prompt: 'Empowering women to lead the digital space starts with the right tools. What are the best practices for aspiring women entrepreneurs looking to create a successful blog and build their online presence?'",
    "Original Prompt: 'The latest trends in web development.' Target User Group: Small Business Owners. Refined Prompt: 'As a small business owner in the digital age, staying up-to-date is crucial. What are the latest trends in web development that you should be aware of to keep your business competitive?'",
    "Original Prompt: 'Healthy meal prep ideas for the week.' Target User Group: Fitness Enthusiasts. Refined Prompt: 'Nutrition is just as important as your workout routine. Fitness enthusiasts, what are your go-to healthy meal prep ideas for fueling up during a rigorous training week?'",
    "Original Prompt: 'Exciting science experiments for middle school students.' Target User Group: Science Educators. Refined Prompt: 'Science educators, ignite curiosity in your classroom! What are some exciting and thought-provoking science experiments that will captivate middle school students?'"
  ]
}
